intro: Scabiosa diffusa, commonly known as the common scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a sprawling or upright growth habit. Its leaves are ovate or lanceolate, with a rough texture, and its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. Scabiosa diffusa is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
